title: Quiz 5: Nutritional Assessment & Community Role
description: Assess knowledge on anthropometric measurements, BMI calculations, and the role of Community Health Assistants.

questions.question: Match the Nutritional Assessment Method (ABCD) with its description:
questions.explanation: A=Measurements, B=Labs, C=Physical Exam signs, D=Eating habits.
questions.hint: A is for measurement; B is for labs; C is for checking the body; D is for diet.

questions.question: BMI is calculated using the formula: Weight (kg) divided by ___BLANK___ squared.
Calculate the BMI for an adult weighing 60kg with a height of 1.5 meters.
questions.explanation: 1.5 * 1.5 = 2.25. 60 / 2.25 = 26.66. This falls in the Overweight range (25-29.9).

questions.question: What is the cut-off for Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) using MUAC for children aged 6-59 months?
questions.explanation: < 115mm indicates SAM (Red). 115-125mm is MAM (Yellow). >125mm is Normal (Green).
questions.hint: It is the lowest threshold (Red zone).

questions.question: Select the correct Roles and Responsibilities of Community Health Assistants (CHAs) regarding nutrition:
questions.explanation: CHAs focus on screening, monitoring, promotion, and distribution of basic supplements, not surgery.
questions.hint: Focus on preventative and community-level actions.

questions.question: Head Circumference (HC) is useful for assessing nutritional status in adults.
questions.explanation: HC is useful for children under two years old as the brain grows fast. It is not useful for adults.

questions.question: What position should the head be in when measuring height, where the line from the ear hole to the lower eyelid is parallel to the floor?
questions.explanation: The Frankfurt position ensures accurate height measurement.

questions.question: Why is MUAC (Mid Upper Arm Circumference) a useful tool for assessment?

options.text: It is independent of height and measures muscle/fat reserves
It is only used for adults

questions.explanation: MUAC is independent of height and is a proxy measure for nutrient reserves, useful for children and pregnant women.
questions.hint: Does it matter how tall the person is for this measurement?

questions.question: Order the steps for taking a Length measurement of a child under 2 years:

items.text: Place the measuring board on a flat surface
Lay the child down on the board
Ensure head touches fixed board and knees are flat

questions.explanation: Prepare equipment -> Position child -> Ensure correct posture -> Read.

questions.question: Which of the following BMIs indicates a 'Normal' nutritional status?
questions.explanation: Normal BMI range is 18.5 to 24.9. 16.5 is underweight, 27.5 is overweight, 31 is obese.
